intro: Acosta monticola, commonly known as the mountain acosta, is a species of flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Acosta monticola is adapted to cold, rocky environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil in alpine regions.
